intro: Riedlea lupulina, commonly known as the yellow riedlea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Riedlea lupulina is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
